options.text: inclination of the polar axis with the ecliptic plane.
Earth’s elliptical orbit around the Sun.
variable distance between the Earth and the Sun.
Earth’s rotation on its polar axis.

variant.question: Which statement about the orbit of the Earth is correct?

options.text: The orbit of the Earth around the Sun is an ellipse with the Sun at one of the foci.
The orbit of the Earth around the Sun is a circle with the Sun at its centre.
The orbit of the Earth is a circle with the Sun at a point next to its centre.
The orbit of the Earth around the Sun is an ellipse with the Sun at a point halfway between the two foci.

variant.question: The inclination of the Earth's spin axis in relation to the plane of rotation around the Sun is the cause of the variable amount of (1) _____ and the changing duration of (2) _____ throughout the year at mid and high latitudes.

options.text: (1) insolation; (2) daylight
(1) variation; (2) an apparent solar day
(1) insolation; (2) an apparent solar day
(1) variation; (2) daylight

variant.question: By the term 'transit' of a heavenly body it is understood that

options.text: the body is passing the meridian of the observer or another specified meridian.
the body is moving.
the body is at the same celestial meridian as another body.
the body is passing the anti meridian of the observer.

variant.question: The angle between the plane of the ecliptic and the plane of the equator is approximately?
What is the meaning of ecliptic?

options.text: The yearly apparent path of the sun around the earth.
The monthly apparent path of the earth around the moon.
The yearly apparent path of the moon around the earth.
The yearly apparent path of the earth around the sun.

variant.question: The main reason for the Earth’s seasons is the...

options.text: inclination of the Earth’s polar axis to the plane of the ecliptic.
length of the day, as stated by Kepler’s second law.
distance between the Sun and the Earth.
elliptical orbit of the Earth around the Sun.

variant.question: The axis of the earth is inclined towards the plane of the ecliptic. How will this affect the temperature in Egypt (25°N), compared South Africa (25°S)?

options.text: In July, the weather will be warmer in Egypt, and in January, the weather will be warmer in South Africa.
In July, the weather will be warmer in South Africa, and in January, the weather will be colder in Egypt.
In July, the weather will be warmer in Egypt, and in January, the weather will be colder in South Africa.
There is no difference.

variant.question: The main reason for the occurrence of seasons on Earth is

options.text: the inclination of the Earth axis with regard to the plane of the ecliptic.
the elliptical form of the orbit of the earth around the Sun.
the distance between the Sun and the Earth.
the length of the day as stated by the second law of Kepler.

variant.question: The reason that the solar day lasts longer than the sidereal day is that

options.text: both the direction of rotation of the Earth around its axis and its orbital rotation around the Sun are the same.
the orbital track of the Earth around the Sun is an ellipse.
the orbital speed of the Earth around its axis diminishes slowly.
the Sun has an own movement through the universe opposite to the movement of the Earth due to the gravitational forces of celestial bodies.
apparent yearly path of the Sun around the Earth.
great circle on the sphere which intersects the Earth’s axis at an angle of 66.5°.
apparent yearly path of the Earth around the Sun.
great circle on the sphere which is perpendicular to the Earth’s axis.

variant.question: Observed from a position on the surface of the Earth the heavenly bodies seem to

options.text: move from East to West.
move from West to East on the Southern Hemisphere.
move from East to West on the Northern Hemisphere.
not change their relative positions on the sky.

variant.question:
The Earth's spin axis is inclined to the plane of the ecliptic. What effect does that have on the duration of daylight at Cambridge (52°N, 000°E) compared with that at La Palma in the Canary islands (29°N, 018°W) on the same day?
Cambridge will have (1) __ hours of daylight on the 1st July and (2) __ hours of daylight on the 1st January.

options.text: (1) more; (2) fewer
(1) more; (2) more
(1) fewer; (2) fewer
(1) fewer; (2) more

variant.question: Consider two different locations in the Northern Hemisphere. The difference in duration between day and night is due to the...

options.text: declination of the Sun and the difference in latitude of the two locations.
inclination of the Earth's spin axis and the difference in longitude of the two locations.
location of the Moon orbiting the Earth and the difference in longitude of the two locations.
date and the difference in longitude of the two locations.
around the Sun is an ellipse with the Sun at one of the foci.
around the Sun is a circle with the Sun at its centre.
around the Sun is an ellipse with the Sun at a point halfway between the two foci.
is a circle with the Sun at a point next to its centre.
